arts.ttl: Fingers pointed and calls for unity as Coventry City suffer Preston set-back
arts.sum: Swiftyslug: Thought it was an all round better performance particularly second half, we are still getting carved up around our own penalty area, but we were worth a point today .That was much better . Coventry City’s wait for a first ever away win at Preston North End continues after Emil Riis’ second half goal proved to be enough to secure a 1-0 home win and three points.

arts.ttl: Angry Mark Robins seeks out referee after narrow Coventry City defeat at Preston
arts.sum: “I think if you take the game in isolation we have done very little wrong,” said the City boss, speaking after the 1-0 defeat, courtesy of an Emil Riis goal in the 72nd minute. The Sky Blues boss revealed he was going in to see the referee Josh Smith after Haji Wright had a goal chalked off in the 82nd minute at Deepdale where the Midlands club extended their miserable record in the league to 23 games without a win.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings as Sky Blues fail at the 23rd attempt at Preston - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Ellis Simms and Ben Sheaf sent City’s only two attempts on goal wide in the opening 45, while Josh Eccles sliced an early second half effort well wide of the keeper’s left-hand post and Norman Bassette volleyed agonisingly off target. Oliver Dovin kept City in the game in the first half with two terrific saves to deny North End No.9 Emil Riis as the home side looked the more threatening in front of goal.
Emil Riis ensured Preston's unbeaten home record under Paul Heckingbottom continued as the Lilywhites beat Coventry 1-0 in the Sky Bet Championship.

arts.ttl: Preston continue resurgence under Paul Heckingbottom with win over Coventry
arts.sum: Coventry have just two wins in 10 league matches.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins makes six changes as blistering Bassette rewarded and goakkeeper changed as Coventry City face Preston
arts.sum: City: Oliver Dovin; Joel Latibeaudiere, Bobby Thomas, Luis Binks, Jay Dasilva: Josh Eccles, Ben Sheaf; Milan van Ewijk, Jack Rudoni, Norman Bassette; Ellis Simms. That would leave Milan van Ewijk on the right of the forward three and Bassette on the left, with Ellis Simms - in for Brandon Thomas-Asante - leading the line.

arts.ttl: Preston North End v Coventry City live build-up, team news and updates from Deepdale
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. The Sky Blues are making their 23rd attempt at getting three points at the Lilywhites' Lancashire home, up against a North End side that sit just a point and place better off than Mark Robins' men after the opening nine games of the 2024/25 campaign.

arts.ttl: Coventry City boss brings up elephant in the room at Preston pre-match presser - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Back to the presser, before our man on the mic had chance to broach the subject, the manager made reference to a CoventryLive Q&A from earlier in the week when my opposite number at the Lancashire Evening Post gave his take on the annoying Sky Blues anomaly, Robins offering: “Apparently we can’t win at Preston!” Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Mark Robins says he & Doug King on same page re Coventry City's expectations
arts.sum: The Sky Blues boss, however, insists he’s “not stupid” and knows that he and his players need to start getting results as they embark on the next block of six games before the next international break – four away and two home, but fixtures he’s very much looking forward to getting to grips with, starting with an always challenging trip to Preston North End, not least because of the fact the club have never won a league game at Deepdale. As for City’s stuttering start and disappointing progress so far this season, Robins has reiterated the need to manage fans’ pre-season expectations, while insisting ambitious owner Doug King understands the process the club are going through to get to the next level, to be able to bridge the considerable gap to a successful promotion to the Premier League .

arts.ttl: ‘Approaches were made’ – Key Coventry City player opens up on summer transfer interest
arts.sum: Coventry City midfielder Ben Sheaf has confirmed he attracted interest in the summer but had no issue staying… The post ‘Approaches were made’ – Key Coventry City player opens up on summer transfer interest appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
